page.description: Several keywords are useful for working with scripts.

item.name: Shared
item.description: All scripts in the current session.

item.name: Global
item.description: All scripts in the current Database

item.name: System
item.description: All scripts until Alpha Anywhere is closed down - so you can change from one database to another, and your class is still defined.

description.p: Without a keyword, the scope of the class is Local (just like a local function). It can only be used in the current script where it is defined. With a keyword, the scope of the class extends beyond the script in which it is defined.
In other words, the scope of a class is much like the scope of a variable.
